skill.name: session-intelligence-harvester
skill.description: This skill should be used after productive sessions to extract learnings and route them to appropriate Reusable Intelligence Infrastructure (RII) components. Use when corrections were made, format drift was fixed, new patterns emerged, or the user explicitly asks to "harvest learnings" or "capture session intelligence". Transforms one-time fixes into permanent organizational knowledge by implementing updates across multiple files.

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only workflow instructions for Claude. No executable code, no network calls, no external commands, and no file system access outside the project directory. Legitimate knowledge management tool.

content.user_title: Harvest session learnings into permanent knowledge
content.value_statement: One-time fixes that are not encoded into RII components will recur. This skill transforms corrective sessions into permanent organizational intelligence by routing learnings to the appropriate components where they will prevent future errors.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes sessions to identify corrections, patterns, and learning opportunities
Routes learnings to correct RII components (CLAUDE.md, agents, skills, commands)
Implements updates across multiple files with precise placement context
Creates Prompt History Records documenting harvests
Commits changes with descriptive messages following git conventions
Validates all updates match target file style and structure
limitations: Requires Claude Code or compatible tool to execute edits
Cannot access files outside the current project directory
Depends on existing RII component structure to route learnings
Learnings must be manually triggered by user or identified session patterns

use_cases.title: Capture team process improvements
use_cases.description: After retrospectives or correction sessions, encode new workflows so all team members automatically benefit from collective learning.

use_cases.title: Prevent recurring AI errors
use_cases.description: When format drift or context gaps cause errors, encode checks and patterns that prevent the same issues in future sessions.

use_cases.title: Build organizational intelligence
use_cases.description: Systematically extract and organize session learnings into reusable knowledge components that scale across the organization.

prompt_templates.title: Basic harvest request
prompt_templates.prompt: Harvest learnings from this session. We fixed [issue] by [correction]. Analyze what caused this and route the learning to prevent recurrence.

prompt_templates.title: Format drift recovery
prompt_templates.prompt: We had format drift in [file]. Correct format is [correct format]. Use session-intelligence-harvester to analyze the root cause, classify the learning, and update relevant RII components.

prompt_templates.title: Pattern identification
prompt_templates.prompt: I noticed we encountered [pattern] for the [Nth] time. Apply session-intelligence-harvester to extract this pattern, identify the convergence behavior, and encode prevention in the appropriate agents.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-file update session
prompt_templates.prompt: This session touched [N] files with similar pattern corrections. Use session-intelligence-harvester to systematically analyze each correction, classify the learnings, route them to correct RII components, and implement all updates.

output_examples.input: Harvest learnings from this session where we fixed the skill format drift by moving skills to domain folders
output: **Session**: Fixed skill format to use domain-based structure
| 1 | Domain organization requirement | Convergence Pattern | skill-creator | Applied |
| 2 | Flat structure failure mode | Failure Mode | CLAUDE.md | Applied |
| 3 | Skills domain routing | Classification | session-intelligence-harvester | Applied |
2. CLAUDE.md: Added failure mode example for flat structure (lines 180-184)
3. session-intelligence-harvester: Updated routing table with domain paths
### Prevents: Future skills using flat structure without domain folders

best_practices: Trigger harvesting immediately after corrective sessions while context is fresh
Always read target files before editing to ensure correct placement and style
Route learnings to the component where they will be discovered at the right time in the workflow
anti_patterns: Proposing updates without implementing them (skill defaults to action)
Routing learnings to wrong RII components based on familiarity rather than when the check triggers
Skipping the PHR creation step, losing context about why changes were made

faq.question: How is this different from creating a PHR?
faq.answer: PHRs document what happened. This skill actively encodes prevention into RII components so future sessions automatically catch issues.

faq.question: Can I use this with other Claude Code skills?
faq.answer: Yes. It complements skills like skill-creator and chapter-planner by updating their configurations when patterns emerge.

faq.question: What RII components can this skill update?
faq.answer: CLAUDE.md files, agent files, skill files, command files, and any files in the .claude directory following RII structure.

faq.question: Does this skill access files outside my project?
faq.answer: No. All file access is limited to the current project directory following RII component paths.

faq.question: What triggers automatic harvesting suggestions?
faq.answer: Session corrections, format drift fixes, adding orchestration checks, identifying failure modes, or touching 3+ files with similar patterns.

faq.question: How does routing to RII components prevent recurrence?
faq.answer: Learnings placed in the correct component are discovered at the right time. A check in content-implementer only helps during content implementation.
